tweets.text:
Astonished to learn that on 14 Jan @EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA told the Public Accounts Committee that "we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Did he intentionally mislead or does he not know that it happens? 

https://t.co/HW3zHY8zIP

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Presumably he is referring to the EA's declared purpose, which includes the phrase  ‚Äúto protect or enhance the environment, taken as a whole‚Äù. 'Taken as a whole' - how many weasels and get-out clauses does that encompass?

Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost by definition, we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Let's just check that statement shall we. https://t.co/tAAPJW9Wge
@timthefruit @kramsivrup @theriverstrust @EnvAgency https://t.co/YGoI8jKByP
@EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork @EnvAgency @OliverHarmarEA Surely this could have been timed better? Summertime and not now?

We‚Äôre continuing with work to replace the gate on the #Foss Barrier in #York this week now that river levels have fallen. Here‚Äôs Mark explaining the latest plans to install the gate by the end of the week. https://t.co/i7onQwWAZx @CityofYork @EnvAgency @OliverHarmarEA https://t.co/aJgfHbsWpJ

urls.title: Massive new flood gate fitted in York
urls.description: The new gate will be air-lifted in place as part of ¬£38 million Foss Barrier upgrade.

tweets.text:
How we manage our water systems and waste can have a massive impact on wildlife, and when done well can create diverse healthy habitats.
 
From our reservoir to our reedbeds CAT's water system showcases how we can manage water and waste to #HelpNatureThrive. https://t.co/Bt2vPGV8HX

domain.name: TV Shows

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

tweets.text: @audlemagronpaul @agricontract @EnvAgency The systems broken, one mans soil can be as good as you like, but if everyone else‚Äôs is pouring down hillsides and off farms, his effort is wasted. Rivers won‚Äôt be dredged so may as well focus on everyone slowing the flow.
@kramsivrup @Hillfortian @theriverstrust @EnvAgency Hi not Ni!

In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: https://t.co/HnN45WjPXD https://t.co/7ltbpezYL8

If the the @EnvAgency CEO @JamesBevanEA is not aware that sewage is discharged into chalk streams what chance have we got. The @RiverChess has had 79 sewage discharges over a 16 month period between 24 Sept 2019 and 25th Jan 2021.

What a brazen liar! I don't suppose any of these embarrassing brown circles coincide with chalk streams!
Pics from @theriverstrust  and @EnvAgency! https://t.co/rO0ckfv0LE https://t.co/H4Bo6zQQFY

Pumping operations continue in #Malton and #Norton as groundwater levels in the area remain high even though river levels are falling. We have a multi-agency pumping plan in place and continue to monitor this to manage levels and reduce #flood risk. https://t.co/6T6t4GZCd0 https://t.co/8ObLQDSWHT
